title: LOCAL MATTERS.
p: WORTHY TRIBUTS -- The following Complimentary letter signed by al the members of the bar in attendance at the recent session of the District Court at Steilacoom, was given to Judge O. Jacobs:
STEILACOOM, W.T., Nov. 6, 1859. HON. ORANGE JACOBS,

Judge of the 3d Judicial District, W.T. Sun: Your fall term has just closed with universal satisfaction to the people and bar of this District, and we cannot refrain from expression your sincere appreciation of your prompines dignity, and unifrom courtesy to us in the relation of attorneys practicing in the Courts of your District.

Though your sta in the Territory has been brief, yet hosts of friends already watch hopefully and confidently your future judicial labors: and we earnestly trust that your sojourn has proven to you as pleasant as to us. That your future may and will be as happy as your past has been promising of success, in the amplest wish we can make, for such is but the index of a useful and popular career in your new home.
Wtih high regard, believe us truly your friends.
John P. Judson, Marshall F. Moore,
